title: Two particles from parametric position part - c

content.description: Two particles move in the xy-plane. For timet≥0 , the position of particle A is given by x=t−2 andy=(t−2)2 , and the position of particle B is given b<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo>−</mo> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C24@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C23@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.
content.question: Determine the exact time at which the particles collide; that is, when the particles are at the same point at the same time. Justify your answer.

frqParts.text: Determine the exact time at which the particles collide; that is, when the particles are at the same point at the same time. Justify your answer.
